Cat Ba Island This is the largest island in Halong Bay, it is the hub for all water sport activities like swimming, snorkelling, kayaking, diving, and caving as well  If you want to experience the best of snorkelling in Vietnam then this is the place to be  Other adventures include trekking, hiking and rock climbing  The beaches might feel overcrowded, but there’s plenty of space to relax, unwind and sunbathe without getting disturbed  You can find your own secluded spot to lay your beach mat and just relax amidst serene views  Location: Halong Bay, Northern Vietnam, Vietnam Timings: 8:00 a m to 5:00 p m  Famous for: For its waters sports activities Entry fee: NA  Vietnam Visa For Indians: Everything You Need To Know Before Applying

Dau Be Island  Famous for flying squirrels, golden monkeys and other species of birds, this island is quite secluded and consists of three ocean basins and a cave that features unique rock formations  The island is best for snorkelling as the marine life is rich and diverse  You can spend hours snorkelling around the island and getting lost in the magical underwater world  You can also swim on this island as it’s comprised of three inland lakes and witness the vibrant corals  Location: Southwestern of Halong Bay, Vietnam Timings: Open all-day Famous for: Diverse Flora and Fauna Entry fee: NA

Ti Top (Titov) Island  Image Source  Ti Top island is one of the most famous and scenic islands of Halong Bay  It is named after a Russian astronaut, Gherman Titov who visited Halong Bay in 1962  The summit of this island can be reached by a steep climb, the panoramic views from the top are worth the climb  It is one of the must places to visit in Halong Bay and ideal for all recreational activities like swimming, kayaking, snorkelling and more  If you’re an adventure enthusiast then we highly recommend you take the hike up the 427 steps to reach the mountaintop gazebo and be rewarded with breathtaking views of the surreal landscape  Location: Located about 14 kilometres to the east of Bai Chay tourist harbour, Vietnam Timings: All day Famous for: Scenic beauty and recreational activities Entry fee: VND50  Vietnamese Street Foods: A Guide To Some Scrumptious Dishes To Try  Sa Pa  Sapa is one of the best places to visit in North Vietnam  The picturesque destination is surrounded by lofty hills and overlooks the rolling plush green valleys with plenty of things to do in Sapa  The topography, the terraced paddy cultivation, and the serene-yet-colourful countryside together has made Sapa an idyllic holiday retreat  Best Time To Visit: March – April and October – November are the best months to visit Sa Pa  The weather is not too hot  Rainfall is little and there is plenty of sunshine

Ta Phin Village  Sa Pa has always been on the top of the list of tourists who want to visit Vietnam  But, this village has been made its place recently on that list  Located 17km west of Sa Pa, this village belongs to the Red Dao’s people who have maintained their traditional lifestyle, away from the touch of modernity  Tips: The roads towards the village aren’t suitable for cars  So, you can hire bikes and visit the village  The journey is also beautiful with astounding views of the road  Location: Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam Timings: NA Famous for: Traditional lifestyle of people and the stunning views Entry fee: VND40,000

Fansipan Mountain  This mountain is the highest in the Indochinese Peninsula and is famously known as the roof of the Indochina  It has stunning sceneries and a beautiful landscape surrounding it that makes it ideal for trekking expeditions for adventure junkies  If you’re not up for a trekking excursion then you can also choose to take the cable car ride to witness the panoramic views of the Indochina region  Explore the rich flora and fauna of this mountain and marvel at the views of the swirling clouds and forested slopes on your way  Location: SaPa, Vietnam Timings: All day Famous for: The highest mountain in the Indochinese peninsula Entry fee: Fansipan cable car tickets – VND70,000 per person (adults)  My Khe Beach: A Handy Tour Guide To This Picturesque Land In Vietnamese

Silver Waterfall  Image Source  The Silver waterfall is a mesmerizing waterfall that has white water cascading down the giant slope of a hill  The sunlight falling on the waters gives it a shining colour and makes it look like silver, hence, the name Silver Waterfall  This waterfall can be visible from afar, and is ideal for hiking in Vietnam adventure  Location: QL4D, San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam Timings: Open 24 hours Famous for: The silver appearance of the stunning waterfall Entry fee: VND20,000

Sand Dunes Of Mui Ne  Mui Ne boasts of its spectacular white and red sand dunes, eroded by oceanic wind  The winds have carved out mind-blowing formations, such as Barchans & Sieve, and display amazing desert topography  As one of the most fascinating Vietnam tourist places, it is crowded during the peak season  Yet, it is quite challenging to explore the entire area by trekking  Hence, people need to hire sledge, quad bikes, and buggies or take an ostrich ride  Location: South China Sea, Southeast Vietnam, Vietnam Timings: NA Famous for: The stunning view of the place and the activities at the place Entry Fee: VND10,000 camps

Places to Visit in Vietnam  Why is Vietnam a popular tourist destination? Vietnam is a country that has almost everything to offer to tourists, right from some very lush and green paddy fields to the curvaceous peaks of mountain ranges  Whether you just want to mingle with the melting pot of cultural ethnicities, or you want to immerse yourself in the hypnotizing beauty of Halong Bay or just want to ride your bike out in the countryside, Vietnam will live up to your expectations on every front  What is Vietnam famous for?  Vietnam has a rich history and has a lot of tangible resources to show for it which include the Hoa Lo Prison of Hanoi, the palatial buildings of Nguyen dynasty, tunnels from the time of the Vietnamese war like the Cu Chi tunnel and a DMZ in central Vietnam housing several monuments and museums  All of this doesn’t discredit the very rich natural biodiversity of Vietnam which ranges from mountains to deltas to plains and what not  Is it safe to travel to Vietnam given the covid situation? Make sure you understand and follow all airline and destination requirements related to travel, testing, masking, or quarantine  You need to follow all the mandatory guidelines and safety protocols mentioned by the government  Make sure that you take the following precautions: 1  Wearing masks and gloves in public places 2  Maintaining social distancing 3  Sanitizing your hands regularly 4  Avoiding crowded spaces 5  In case of any symptoms, get yourself tested urgently  Is Vietnam cheap for tourists?  Vietnam is a developing nation, with comparatively low costs for travellers  The costs are comparable to Thailand and other nearby countries  However, the accommodation cost is a bit high  The cost will depend on the kind of stay, the number of days you plan for and the food that you want to try  What is the most visited place in Vietnam?  Vietnam is full of stunning sightseeing points and places  It is difficult to pick any particular place as there are a lot of famous places amongst tourists  Some of which are Ha Long Bay, Ho Chi Minh city, Hanoi, Hue and many more  What should I avoid in Vietnam? Vietnam is continuously growing in terms of tourism and so are the concerns and problems related to it  Few things you should take care of are: 1  Avoid carrying any money while travelling, in order to avoid robbery or being a victim of pickpockets  Do not wear shorts, dresses or skirts, or tops with low-necklines and bare shoulders to Temples and Pagodas   Public display of affection is frowned upon  Do not take photos of any military installation or anything to do with the military as that may come under breach of national security  Be a responsible tourist and respect the locals and the place  Which is the best place to visit in Vietnam?  Ha Giang, Sa Pa, Hanoi’s Old Quarter, Ha Long Bay, Ninh Binh and Phong Nha are some of the best places to visit in Vietnam which cannot be missed  It is advised to all the tourists to keep a perfect balance between exploring the rural areas with breathtaking landscapes and the big cities which stand as a testament to modern society  Is Vietnam safe to visit? Vietnam is quite a safe place to travel as the rules and regulations are quite strict here and people abide by them  The police here keep a tight grip and there are rarely any reports of theft and robbery in the country,although scams and hassles still persist at Hanoi, HCMC, and Nha Trang  Where is the best nightlife in Vietnam?  Some of the best places to explore the nightlife in Vietnam are Bia Hoi junction, Saigon Saigon rooftop bar, Sky36 club Da Nang, Rex Hotel Rooftop Bar and Level 23 Wine Bar  The best part about the nightlife in Vietnam is that it brews some of the cheapest draft beer in the world  How many days are enough to explore Vietnam? A traveler visiting Vietnam must have at least 2 weeks in hand to explore the best sights of the country and to explore the places which are quite unusual, 3 weeks are enough  However, 10 days is the minimum period one should keep in hand to cover the 4 most iconic Vietnamese spots- Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Halong Bay and Hoi An  What is the best month to visit in Vietnam?  The summer months which start from May to August are the summer months which are typically hot and humid, while during the spring time which starts from March to April it is quite pleasant as the weather is warm and sunny  What to wear in Vietnam?  The travellers can pack loose and breathable clothes which cover up the knees and shoulders, while there are swim shorts and bathing suits  Alongside that people can also carry Sarong, light jackets and fleece, while for the winters there can be a warm hoodie which will be perfect to enjoy the time here in the country  People Also Read:  Places To Visit In China Places To Visit In Japan Places To A traveler visiting Vietnam must have at least 2 weeks in hand to explore the best sights of the country and to explore the places which are quite unusual, 3 weeks are enough  However, 10 days is the minimum period one should keep in hand to cover the 4 most iconic Vietnamese spots- Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Halong Bay and Hoi An  What is the best month to visit in Vietnam?  The summer months which start from May to August are the summer months which are typically hot and humid, while during the spring time which starts from March to April it is quite pleasant as the weather is warm and sunny  What to wear in Vietnam?  The travellers can pack loose and breathable clothes which cover up the knees and shoulders, while there are swim shorts and bathing suits  Alongside that people can also carry Sarong, light jackets and fleece, while for the winters there can be a warm hoodie which will be perfect to enjoy the time here in the country  People Also Read:  Places To Visit In China Places To Visit In Japan Places To text: Fort Aguada Rd, Aguada Fort Area, Candolim, Goa 403515

Sightseeing in Goa is incomplete without a visit to Fort Aguada, strategically situated at the estuary of the river Mandovi. On the north side of the fort, a rampart of red-brown laterite forms a jetty between two small sandy coves, known as Sinquerim Beach. The fort houses the Central Jail and a 19th-century lighthouse. It was built by the Portuguese between 1609-1612. The fort is open from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM every day, and there is no entry fee.

Chapora Fort is popular for its history and became famous after the Bollywood movie Dil Chahta Hai was shot here. Perched in a prominent position, it offers sweeping views in all directions, including picturesque views of the Chapora river uniting with the Arabian Sea. Built by Adil Shah of Bijapur, the fort is well-connected and can be easily reached by road. Nearby attractions include Vagator Beach and Anjuna Beach. There is no entry fee.

Terekhol Fort is situated on the Terekhol River at the northern tip of Goa, on a hillock overlooking the Arabian Sea. It houses the century-old Chapel of St. Anthony and offers captivating views of the Tiracol River and the sandy Keri beach. Built in the 17th century by the Raja of Sawantwadi and later occupied by Viceroy Pedro Miguel de Almeida, the remains of the fort have now been converted into a hotel. Nearby attractions include Arambol and Palolem Beach. The fort can be reached easily by hiring a taxi or an auto from any place in the north of Goa, and there is no entry fee.

Reis Mogos Fort was constructed by Alfonso de Noronha, the Portuguese Viceroy, in 1551 and reconstructed in 1707. The fort served as a defensive site during the war between the Portuguese and the Marathas. It is located 7 kilometers from the Panjim Kadamba Bus Stand, on the banks of the Mandovi River. Nearby attractions include Keri Beach and Redi Ganpati Temple. The fort is open from 9:30 AM to 5 PM every day, and there is no entry fee. It can be easily reached by hiring a taxi or an auto from any place in the north of Goa.
Taluka Cabo da Rama, Canacona, Goa

Cabo De Rama Fort, also known as the Cape of Rama, is notable for its historical and mythological significance. The fort was reconstructed by the Portuguese in 1763 after being seized from the Maratha King of Sonda. It is located 60 kilometers from the Panjim Kadamba Bus Stand in South Goa. Nearby attractions include Kakolem Beach and Agonda Beach. The fort is open from 9 AM to 5:30 PM every day, and there is no entry fee. It can be easily reached from any major hub in South Goa via public transport.

Corjuem Fort is one of the smaller forts in Goa, known for offering excellent panoramic views of the surrounding area. It is a popular destination for architecture enthusiasts and history lovers. The fort, built by the Portuguese in 1705, has survived into the 21st century with its two inland forts. Nearby attractions include Aguada Fort and Calangute Beach. The fort is open from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM and there is no entry fee. It is well connected by road.

Bom Jesus Basilica is a world-famous tourist place in Goa, known for its Baroque architecture and fine detailing carved from basalt embellishments. It is one of the richest facades in Goa and offers a place to indulge in tranquility. Built by the Portuguese between 1609 and 1612, the basilica is located around 10 km from Panjim in Old Goa. Visitors can hire a taxi from Panjim to reach it in about 20 minutes. The basilica is open from Monday to Saturday from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM, and on Sunday from 10:00 AM to 6:30 PM. There is no entry fee.

Se Cathedral is one of the largest Asian churches and a major tourist attraction in Old Goa. It faces the Basilica of Bom Jesus and is recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Established as a tribute to St. Catherine, it serves as the Archdiocese's seat in Goa. The cathedral was built by Julião Simão between 1609-1612. It is open from 7 AM to 6:30 PM and there is no entry fee.
Church Of St Francis Of Assisi
Off National Highway 4, Goa Velha, Goa

The Church Of St Francis Of Assisi is one of the oldest churches in Goa, located in Panjim. Known for its grand and elaborately designed architecture, it houses a statue of Mother Mary in front of a striking tower. One of its highlights is the world's 2nd largest bell. Built by the Portuguese in 1661, the church is open from 7 AM to 6:30 PM with no entry fee.

The Church Of St Cajetan, also known as the Church of Divine Providence, is a charming Roman Catholic church located in Old Goa. Completed in 1661, it is a part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site – Churches and Convents of Goa. The stunning white structure features a large dome and Latin inscriptions on its walls. Designed in the shape of a Greek cross, this architectural marvel is situated close to the Mandovi River. The church is open from 7 AM to 6:30 PM with no entry fee.

Thalassa Restaurant is one of the most famous dining spots in Goa, especially popular among regular tourists. It offers a perfect sunset view overlooking the expansive sea. For the best experience, seating outside is recommended to enjoy the scenic beauty. The restaurant is open from 10:00 AM to 11:30 PM every day. It is well-connected by road, and the approximate price for two people is INR 2000.
Behind The Leela, Mobor, Cavelossim, Goa

The Fisherman's Wharf is a popular destination in Goa known for its seafood offerings and vibrant atmosphere. It attracts crowds with its ship-like decor and serves delicious dishes like tandoori pomfret, masala fried prawns, and fish curry rice. Live performances enhance the dining experience, especially on Sundays during lunch hours. The backdrop of backwaters adds to the memorable ambiance. The restaurant is open from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM every day, and it is well-connected by road. The approximate price for two people is INR 1500.
Small Vagator Beach, Ozran, Vagator, Goa

Anteras is renowned among Goa's famous places, offering sun-kissed meals and a unique dining experience. Located at Small Vagator Beach, it is known for its authentic delicacies prepared with creativity and dedication. Visitors can enjoy stunning sunset views while dining. The restaurant is open from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM every day, and it is well-connected by road. The approximate price for two people is INR 2000.
Titos Ln, Near Baga Beach, Saunta Vaddo, Calangute, Goa

Tito's Club is the biggest entertainment hub in Goa, renowned for hosting high-profile celebrity DJs and featuring a large dance floor. It is among the top tourist attractions in Goa, known for special acts, dance performances, and versatile bartenders skilled in fire acts and bar flaring. The club has received the Times Nightlife Award for the “Best Nightclub in Goa”. Operating hours are from 6:00 PM to 3:00 AM. The club is well-connected by road, and the approximate price for two people is INR 3,000.

Mambo's is one of the most happening tourist places in North Goa and has significantly influenced the clubbing scene in the region. Known for its lively atmosphere, Mambo's opens from 9:00 PM onwards, offering a chilled-out zone to meet friends and enjoy drinks. The club features both in-house DJs and renowned international DJs playing a variety of music genres. It hosts special theme nights including retro music and trance nights, and is a venue for many festivals in Goa. Operating hours are from 6:00 PM to 4:00 AM. Mambo's is well-connected by road, and the approximate price for two people is INR 3,000.
House No 7, 171, Calangute – Baga Rd, Saunta Vaddo, Baga, Goa

Britto's is a fine-dining Italian restaurant known as De Baga Deck, located in Baga, Goa. It is renowned for serving scrumptious and tantalizing food, particularly specializing in seafood and multi-cuisines. The restaurant offers a unique ambience with large French windows providing uninterrupted and spectacular views of the Arabian Sea. Tasty cocktails, great music, and a pleasing ambience are highlights of Britto's. It is open throughout the year from 8:30 AM to 12:00 AM, making it a perfect place to unwind after a day of sightseeing in Goa. Britto's is well-connected by road, and the approximate price for two people is INR 3,200.

Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuary is Goa’s second-largest wildlife reserve, renowned for its diverse flora and fauna. While it may not feature prowling wild animals, visitors can encounter Sloth Bears, Laughing Hyenas, Indian Bisons, Monkeys, and the Malabar Crested Eagle. The sanctuary offers serene walks through wooded areas where visitors can enjoy the tranquility of nature. It is one of the best places in Goa to explore and witness intriguing wildlife. Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuary is located 60 kilometers south of Panaji in Canacona Taluka. It is open from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM every day, and the sanctuary can be reached by hiring a cab or taxi from Panaji.

Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary is located on the western extreme of Chorao Island, renowned for its mangrove forests and diverse bird species including mudskipper and black drongo. Named after the Indian ornithologist Salim Ali, the sanctuary offers a peaceful escape into the wilderness. It is considered one of the best places in Goa to explore nature and birdlife. The sanctuary is open from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM. To reach Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary, visitors can hire a cab or taxi from Panaji. It is located approximately 58 kilometers from Panaji.

Mandovi-Zuari Wildlife Sanctuary is one of the most visited sanctuaries in Goa, known for its diverse range of species. It hosts rare species such as Kandelia Candel along with various birds, snakes, jackals, and crocodiles. Located on Chorao Island, the sanctuary provides a habitat for a rich biodiversity. It is open from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Visitors can reach the sanctuary by hiring a cab or taxi from Panaji.

Bhagwan Mahavir Wildlife Sanctuary, formerly known as Mollem Game Sanctuary, is located in Sanguem Taluka, Goa. It was officially named Bhagwan Mahavir Wildlife Sanctuary in 1969 and is the largest among the four wildlife sanctuaries in Goa. The sanctuary includes the scenic Mollem National Park. It is open from 6:00 AM to 6:30 PM. Visitors can hire a cab or taxi from Panaji, which is approximately 10 km away.

Bondla Wildlife Sanctuary is the smallest wildlife sanctuary in Goa and is popular among tourists. It offers a variety of flora and fauna species, along with attractions like a deer safari park and botanical gardens. It is a favorite spot for photography enthusiasts, children, and environmentalists alike. The sanctuary is open from 9 AM to 5 PM, closed on Mondays. Visitors can hire a cab or taxi from Panaji, which is approximately 34 km away.

Mapusa Market is one of the most famous shopping destinations in Goa. Located just outside the Mapusa Municipal Market, it offers a wide array of stalls selling local goods brought by farmers and small entrepreneurs from across the state. Visitors can shop for artifacts, clothes, accessories, souvenirs, and much more. The market is open from 6 AM to 8 PM.

Saturday Night Market is a popular flea market located in Arpora, Goa. It is a sprawling market where visitors can find everything from spices to jewelry, unique creations, international designer items, vintage goods, and more. The market also hosts live concerts and is frequented by hippies who sell various goodies. It has even featured in Bollywood films. The market is open in the evenings and offers a lively atmosphere, making it one of the best places for sightseeing in Goa.
10, St Michael’s Vaddo South, Anjuna, Goa 403509

Anjuna Flea Market is a favorite among backpackers and tourists in Goa. Located in Anjuna, it opens only on Wednesdays and offers a wide variety of goods including fruits, clothes, accessories, and electronic devices. It's known for its unique items and vibrant atmosphere, attracting hippies and backpackers alike. Bargaining is encouraged here, allowing visitors to score great deals. The market is especially lively during the tourist season from October to March.
Fort Aguada Rd, Aguada Fort Area, Candolim, Goa 403515

Aguada Beach is known for its pristine landscape and delightful views, complemented by the ancient citadels of Fort Aguada nearby. Popular among honeymooners, the beach offers a serene environment and is ideal for relaxation. Visitors can also explore the nearby lighthouse, which provides stunning panoramic views of the beach from an elevated perspective.

Arambol Beach is renowned for its Bohemian atmosphere, making it a popular destination among long-term hippies and youthful backpackers. The beach offers a relaxed environment with peace and tranquility, attracting vacationers seeking an escape from the bustling beaches of Goa. Visitors can also enjoy water sports such as paragliding and kitesurfing.

Baga Beach is a famous tourist destination in Goa, known for its majestic white sand and lively atmosphere. It is a center of tourist attraction with its pristine white waves washing away footprints on the sand while palm trees sway in the wind. Popular activities at Baga Beach include parasailing, banana boat rides, and sunbathing. Couples particularly enjoy this beach for its romantic ambiance and array of fun experiences. Beachside shacks and cafes offer delectable Goan delicacies and soothing music.

Anjuna Beach is one of the most popular tourist places in Goa, famous as the 'freak capital of the world'. It is renowned for its full-moon parties, acid house parties, and trance parties that attract party enthusiasts from around the globe. Anjuna Beach is historically associated with the hippie culture, where spiritual traditions of the East blended with Western art, ideas, and music. The beach offers a vibrant and energetic atmosphere with its unique cultural fusion.

Butterfly Beach, located north of Palolem Beach, is a serene and unexplored destination in Goa. It offers peace and isolation, making it ideal for travelers seeking tranquility. The beach is surrounded by rocks and can be reached via a thrilling paddle boat ride, where visitors might also spot dolphins along the way. Known for its clean waters, Butterfly Beach attracts tourists looking to relax in a pristine natural setting.

Calangute Beach, also known as the Queen of Beaches, is a popular destination in Goa that attracts hordes of European tourists and hippies. It offers a vibrant atmosphere with opportunities for adventure such as parasailing, water-skiing, wind-surfing, and dolphin trips. The beach is bustling with nightlife and hosts bustling flea markets, making it a perfect place to visit whether you're traveling with friends, alone, or with your partner.

Colva Beach is located 33 kilometers away from the Panjim Kadamba Bus Stand and 8 kilometers from the Margao Railway Station in South Goa. It is considered one of the largest and oldest beaches in the southern region of Goa, making it a must-visit tourist attraction. Known as one of the best places in Goa for couples, Colva Beach is famous for its lively nightlife with numerous pubs and bars, making it an ideal spot for party lovers.

Cansaulim Beach, along with Arossim and Cuelim, forms the second largest coastline stretch in India. It is an extended part of Velsao Beach and is renowned as one of the most charming picnic spots in Goa. The beach is characterized by its white sands and abundant palm trees, offering scenic views and a tranquil atmosphere. Located at the northernmost tip of Velsao Beach, Cansaulim is perfect for those seeking secluded beaches in Goa, ideal for photography and leisurely walks.

Benaulim Beach is located very close to Colva Beach and offers a variety of activities beyond relaxation. Visitors can indulge in water sports such as jet skiing, parasailing, and wind surfing. The beach is also ideal for romantic candlelit dinners and offers several sightseeing options nearby, including Sernabatim Lake, Ramola Super Market, Sernabatim Beach, Copelwaddo Chapel, and St. Anthony's Church.

Dona Paula Beach is counted among the best tourist places to visit in Goa, known for its tragic history associated with love and suicide. The beach offers a range of thrilling activities for adventurous souls, including water skiing, windsurfing, and parasailing. For picturesque views of the Arabian Sea, visitors can head to the jetty located next to the beach.
Ashvem Beach, Mandrem village, North Goa

Ashvem Beach is located in the Mandrem village of North Goa. It is characterized by tall palm trees lining extensive white sands, offering a perfect setting for relaxation. The beach is known for its secluded spots, making it ideal for those seeking solitude. Visitors can enjoy lip-smacking seafood from restaurants on the beach, such as La Cucina, S2 Beach Shack, Paradise Beach Shack, and Cafe Sea Green Back Shack.

Mobor Beach is one of the most exotic beaches in South Goa, known for its picturesque views and vibrant atmosphere. It attracts several tourists every year who enjoy dancing and soaking in the beautiful surroundings. The beach is often described as a piece of heaven due to its stunning scenery.

Sinquerim Beach is renowned for its amazing shoreline and breathtaking views, making it a must-visit on any list of top Goa tourist places. It is ideal for families and friends, offering opportunities for swimming and various water activities.

Querim Beach, also known as Keri Beach, is located in the northern region of Goa and is the largest beach in the area. It offers a tranquil environment away from the bustling tourist beaches of Goa. Visitors can enjoy the pristine and untouched landscapes, surrounded by unkempt crops and natural beauty. The beach is popular for water activities such as surfing, paragliding, banana rides, and kayaking.

Chorao Island, also known as the 'Stunning Precious Stone' in Sanskrit, is the largest island in Goa. Initially settled by Portuguese noblemen, it has evolved into a quaint destination featuring old churches and villas. The island's tranquil atmosphere attracts visitors seeking a peaceful retreat. It is renowned for its serene environment amidst natural beauty.

Divar Island is celebrated for its impeccable beauty and retains much of its original charm due to minimal commercialization. Located in the Mandovi River, this island offers a glimpse into the Goan countryside with its small village atmosphere. It hosts the famous Bonderam festival, attracting a large number of tourists. Accessible via ferry near Viceroy’s Arch, it is a top choice among the best places to visit in Old Goa.

Grand Island lives up to its name by offering an offbeat yet adventurous experience for tourists in Goa. It is renowned for excellent scuba diving sites such as Suzy’s Wreck, Shelter Cove, and Bounty Bay, making it a paradise for water sports enthusiasts. Located in Sautavaddo, Calangute, it is a must-visit spot for a day trip to enjoy snorkelling and other water activities.
Ourem Road, Rua de Ourém, Mala, Panaji, Goa

The Archives Museum, also known as the Museum of Goa, is located in a new building at Patto Plaza near Ourem Creek in Panaji. It is renowned for housing over eight thousand interesting artifacts, making it one of the top tourist places to visit in Goa. The museum offers a fascinating glimpse into the history and culture of the region through its extensive collection.

Panaji, the capital city of Goa, is located on the southern left bank of the Mandovi River. It is celebrated for its picturesque setting and is considered one of the best places to visit in Goa with family. The city is best explored on foot, allowing visitors to wander through old-world lanes and past heritage houses. The market in Panaji offers a wide range of local goods and is a must-visit for shopping enthusiasts.

Dudhsagar Waterfalls in Goa are renowned for their captivating beauty, featuring four levels of cascading water. These falls are among the tallest in India, standing at a height of 1017 feet with an average width of 100 feet. Located near the border between Goa and Karnataka, within the Bhagwan Mahavir Sanctuary, Dudhsagar Waterfalls offer a refreshing escape and are popular for family picnics.
Dinanath Mangeshkar Rd, Mangeshi Village, Mardol, Goa 403401

Shri Mangeshi Temple is situated at a distance of 37 kilometres from the Vasco Da Gama Railway Station. This temple is considered to be one of the most prominent attractions in North Goa. It is one of the must-visit places in Goa, as it is a major pilgrimage site here. The temple is also considered to be the largest and richest Hindu shrines in the Indian state of Goa.
Kapileswari – Kavlem Rd, Donshiwado, Ponda, Goa 403401

Shri Shantadurga Temple is one of the biggest and most frequented temples in Goa. This temple is devoted to Shantadurga, the Goddess of Peace, also referred to as Santeri. It is a prominent location in North Goa and a popular spot among locals.
Mushtifund Saunthan Panaji, Dada Vaidhya Road, Panaji, Goa 403001

Shri Mahalaxmi Temple, located in Bandora Village, 4 kilometers from Ponda, is devoted to Mahalaxmi, the consort of Lord Vishnu. The idol of Devi is depicted wearing a linga on her head. This religious site welcomes pilgrims throughout the year.

Candolim Beach is a hub for adventure freaks holidaying in Goa, offering an array of daring water sports. You can rent a scooter and drive to Fort Aguada or relax by the beach, capturing mesmerizing views of sunsets and sunrises.

Tito's Street is home to some of the most electrifying clubs in Goa. The area offers a variety of clubs in a prime location. After sunset, numerous partygoers head to Tito's Street for the best nightlife experience in Goa. The place also offers delicious food and is a haven for shopaholics.
Market town of Chaudi in South Goa

Palolem Beach is among the most gorgeous beaches in Goa. During the day, it becomes crowded with hawkers offering delicious seafood and various decorative items. This popular tourist attraction offers mesmerizing views and is perfect for nature lovers who want to experience the true vibe of Goa.

The Casino Cruise in Goa offers an enthralling and luxurious experience. Docked on a popular river, this cruise is equipped with posh furnishings and provides spellbinding views during the day. At night, from 9 pm to 3 am, it transforms into a lively venue with DJ nights. It is a must-visit for anyone looking to add a touch of Vegas-style entertainment to their Goan vacation.
The Church Of Our Lady Of Immaculate Conception
Rua Emídio Garcia, Altinho, Panaji, Goa 403001

The Church Of Our Lady Of Immaculate Conception is one of the most visited churches in Goa, located in the capital city of Panaji. Originally established as a chapel in 1541, the larger building was constructed in 1619. It holds significant historical importance, particularly for Old Portuguese sailors. The church is renowned for its multicolored interior and unique architecture, which exudes peace and delight to its visitors.

Club Cubana is one of the most popular clubs in Goa, renowned for its dazzling ambiance and amazing nightlife experiences. Known as the “Nightclub in the Sky”, it offers electrifying parties that elevate the vacation experience. It is a must-visit for party animals looking to enjoy vibrant parties with friends or travel partners.

Lamgau Caves are popular tourist places in North Goa, known for their interesting man-made structure. These caves attract visitors from around the world and hold significance for the Hindu community. Besides being a tourist destination, they are also recognized as educational and cultural sites.

Arvalem Waterfall is a well-known scenic waterfall in Goa, though not as enormous as Dudhsagar Waterfalls. It is among the best places to visit in Goa, especially during the monsoon months when the sight is splendid. Located close to Panaji, the waterfall offers various activities nearby. It's a gorgeous natural attraction that attracts visitors with its picturesque setting.

Tokyo is the city that reflects the colors of Japan. It boasts endless attractions and is known for its anime culture and world-class sites. Popular attractions include Tokyo Disneyland, Tokyo Skytree, and Tokyo DisneySea. Visitors can spend an evening near the Tokyo Tower, shop in Odaiba, or witness the grandeur of the Meiji Shrine. Tokyo also has a great culinary scene with notable places to eat like Tapas Molecular Bar, Ise Sueyoshi, and Sometarō. Accommodations include Guest House Trace, Manga Art Hotel, and Khaosan Tokyo Samurai. The city is well-connected by airways, with many airlines connecting to Narita Airport.

Kyoto is known as the city of shrines, gardens, and palaces. It is one of the best places to visit in Japan in spring, whether you are holidaying with family or a partner. The city is home to iconic temples, shrines, palaces, gardens, and bamboo forests. Top attractions include Kyoto Imperial Palace, Philosopher’s Walk, and Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine. Visitors can also explore the Kiyomizu Temple, Nijo Castle, and Kinkaku-ji. Accommodations in Kyoto include Village Kyoto, Downtown Inn Kyoto, and Santiago Guesthouse Kyoto. Notable places to eat are Samurai Juku, Sugarhill Kyoto, and Saishuan Shiraki. The closest airport is Osaka International Airport, approximately 1 hour from the city.

Home to adorable deers, temples, shrines, monasteries, museums, and the famous Nara Park, Nara is where you need to be to get familiarized with the famed Japanese culture and traditions. Top attractions include Nara Park, Kasuga-taisha, and the Ninja Museum of Igaryu. Visitors can visit the Isuien Garden, befriend the deers at the Nara-koen Park, and explore the Nara National Museum. Accommodations include Smile Hotel Nara, Super Hotel Lohas JR Nara Eki, and Guesthouse Nara Komachi. Notable places to eat are Kameya, Kura, and Tonkatsu Ganko Nara. Kansai International Airport is the closest airport to Nara, approximately 1.5 hours away.

Renowned for offering the most thrilling experiences in Japan, Mt Fuji is a paradise for adventure seekers. The official climbing season is from July to September, but the beauty can be witnessed from a distance throughout the year. Top attractions include Mount Tenjo, Chureito Pagoda, and Fujiyoshida Sengen Shrine. Visitors can go skiing, visit Arakurayama Sengen Park, and enjoy views from the Subashiri 5th Station. Accommodations include Hatago Ichiya, Bself Fuji Villa, and Hotel Mount Fuji. Notable places to eat are Hoto Fudou, Tempura Restaurant, and Ninja Tetsuyaki. The nearest airport is Shizuoka Airport, 83.5 km away.

Hokkaido is known for its volcanoes, hot springs, and ski areas, making it a perfect holiday destination with both your kids and significant other. The island boasts natural hot springs and stunning views. Top attractions include Asahiyama Zoo, Farm Tomita, and Blue Pond. Visitors can relax in the hot springs, treat themselves to scrumptious seafood, and visit famous national parks. Accommodations include Yorkshire Farm, Hotel Park Hills, and Hokkaido Puremiahoteru – CABIN – Obihiro. Notable places to eat are Daruma, Hokkaido Cafe, and Hokkaido Ramen Kyowakoku. The closest airport is New Chitose Airport Sapporo.

Ishigaki Island is a trending travel spot known for offering unique experiences and glamming up holidays in Japan. It is especially popular during the cherry blossom season. Top attractions include Kabira Bay, Taketomi Island, and Ishigaki Limestone Cave. Visitors can indulge in snorkeling, relax on the beaches, and savor Ishigaki Beef. Accommodations include Ishigaki Guesthouse HIVE, Blue Cabin Ishigakijima, and Ishigaki Seaside Hotel. Notable places to eat are Sushi Taro, Usagiya, and Akebono. The closest airport is Ishigaki Airport, 18 km away, with local buses and taxis available for transportation.

Hiroshima is known for its historical significance, being a victim of the atomic bombings. However, it also has other spellbinding attractions like the Itsukushima shrine. Top attractions include Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park & Museum, Hiroshima Castle, and Itsukushima. Visitors can try Okonomiyaki, the local delicacy, visit the Mazda Museum, and capture pictures at the Shukkeien Garden. Accommodations include K’s House Hiroshima, Grand Prince Hotel Hiroshima, and Court Hotel Hiroshima. Notable places to eat are Parco della Pace, Guttsuri-ann, and Nagataya. The closest airports are Iwakuni and Matsuyama airports, 70 km away.

Sapporo is a haven for beer and ski lovers, helping you escape the heat and humidity while discovering a winter wonderland during its famous Sapporo Annual Snow Festival. Top attractions include Moerenuma Park, Former Hokkaido Government Office, and Mount Moiwa Observation Deck. Visitors can also visit the Sapporo Beer Museum, party in Susukino, and indulge in local delicacies at the Curb Market. Accommodations include The Stay Sapporo, Relief Sapporosusukino Hotel, and Tmark City Hotel Sapporo. Notable places to eat are Gotsubo Oyster Bar, Hyousetsu No Mon, and Sapporo Beer Garden. The closest airport is New Chitose Airport Sapporo, 53 km away.

Osaka is known for its shopping arcades, incredible food, and vibrant nightlife. Top attractions include Universal Studios Japan, Osaka Castle, and Dotonbori. Visitors can visit the Kaiyukan Aquarium, the Hozenji Temple, and go beer tasting and partying at night. Accommodations include Hotel Taiyo, Hotel Fine Garden Juso, and APA Hotel Osaka Higobashi Ekimae. Notable places to eat are Osaka Tacos, Giga Rabbit Curry, and Yakumido. The nearest airports are Kansai International Airport and Osaka International Airport.

Yakushima is an island famous for its wildlife, cedar forests, and waterfalls. It offers a unique experience for nature lovers. Top attractions include Senpirono Falls, Jōmon Sugi, and Mt Miyanoura. Visitors can kayak or canoe in the Anbo river, witness the Oko-no-taki Waterfall, and watch Loggerhead turtles lay eggs. Accommodations include Seaside Hotel Yakushima and Guesthouse Yakushima. Notable places to eat are Yakushima Curry House, Panorama, and Wakadaisho. The closest airport is Tanegashima airport.

Hakuba is a village and famous winter sports hub situated amidst the Japanese Alps. It offers incredible skiing, snowboarding, and hiking experiences. Top attractions include Mt Shirouma, Hakuba Happoone Winter Resort, and Lake Aoki. Visitors can ski at the Cortina Resort, visit Hakuba 47 Winter Sports Park, and hike to the Happo Pond. Accommodations include Courtyard by Marriott Hakuba, Morino lodge, and Hakuba Highland Hotel. Notable places to eat are Raicho Lodge Madarao, B O S, and Izakaya Kaz. The closest airports are Tokyo’s Narita and Haneda Airports.

Kamakura is a seaside town boasting bamboo groves, ancient temples, vibrant beaches, great shopping alleys, and local delicacies. Top attractions include the Enoshima Aquarium, Kamakura Museum of Literature, and Kannon Museum. Visitors can witness the Great Buddha of Kamakura, go surfing at Shonan Beach, and visit the Jufukuji Temple. Accommodations include Kamakura Park Hotel, 8HOTEL, and WeBase Hostel. Notable places to eat are Kebab Kamakura, Sometaro, and Miyoshi Udon-noodle & Sake. The closest airport is Tokyo Haneda Airport.

Located in the heart of central Japan, Nagano is known for hidden gems like the Ninja Village for kids, Shiga Kogen Ski Resort, and Zenko-ji Temple. The city offers a pleasant breeze throughout the year. Top attractions include Karuizawa, Matsumoto Castle, and Kamikouchi. Visitors can visit the Zenko-ji Temple, enjoy winter sports at Shiga Kogen Heights Ski Resort, and rejuvenate at Shirahone Onsen. Accommodations include Hotel Metropolitan Nagano, Hotel JAL City Nagano, and Hotel Mielparque Nagano. Notable places to eat are Nihonmatsu Ramen, Misoya, and Shinshu nagaya sakaba. The nearest airport is Matsumoto Airport, 58 km away.

Kawaguchi is famous for Lake Kawaguchiko and breathtaking views of Mt Fuji. It is also a cultural gem with vibrant attractions. Top attractions include Lake Kawaguchiko, Fujiten Snow Resort, and Oshino Hakkai. Visitors can attend the Shibazakura Festival, paddle around Lake Kawaguchiko, and sip on Koshu Wine. Accommodations include Smile Hotel Kawaguchi, Wa Style Hotel Tokyo, and Kawaguchi Station Hotel. Notable places to eat are Kaenzen Restaurant, Itsumo Korean Restaurant, and Pusan Korean Restaurant. The nearest airport is Tokyo Haneda Airport.

Nestled in the mountains of Gifu, Takayama is known for its old-world charm and stunning attractions. Top attractions include Hida no Sato, Takayama Festival Floats Exhibition Hall, and Sanmachi Suji District. Visitors can go back in time at Takayama Jinya, stay in a farmhouse, and attend the Takayama Festival. Accommodations include Takayama Ouan, Ryokan Tanabe, and Best Western Hotel Takayama. Notable places to eat are Heianraku, Suzuya Restaurant, and Kyōya. The nearest airport is Toyama Airport, 57 km away.

Shibuya is known for its impressive footfall, spectacular scramble crossing, and multiple shopping places with cool clothing brands. Top attractions include Meiji Jingu, Yoyogi Park, and Omotesandō. Visitors can enjoy the nightlife at Roppongi, treat their shopping craving at Takeshita Street, and witness mesmerizing views at Roppongi Hills. Accommodations include Mustard Hotel Shibuya, Shibuya Hotel En, and Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu. Notable places to eat are Uobei, Ichiran Shibuya, and Hakushu Teppanyaki. The nearest airport is Haneda Airport.

Naoshima is a tiny island set amidst the Seto Inland Sea, offering art museums, sculptures, and modern architecture. Top attractions include Lee Ufan Museum, Benesse House, and Naoshima Bath. Visitors can witness the fine work of Tadao Ando at Chichu Art Museum, visit Kojin Island for peace and quiet, and experience nature's charm in the Labyrinth of Cherry Blossom. Accommodations include SPARKY’s House, Benesse House Hotel, and Park Building inn Hoshikuzu. Notable places to eat are apron cafe, Cafe Salon Nakaoku, and Issen. The nearest airport is Takamatsu Airport, 27 km away.

Asakusa is known as the cultural hub of Tokyo, offering a mix of activities for different kinds of travelers. Top attractions include Asakusa Shrine, Amuse Museum, and Hanayashiki Amusement Park. Visitors can experience blessed vibes at Sensō-ji, have a unique gaming time at Escape Game Nazobako Tokyo, and visit Kappabashi-dori for top-notch restaurants. Accommodations include Asakusa View Hotel, Red Planet Tokyo Asakusa, and Smile Hotel Asakusa. Notable places to eat are Sometarō, Kikkō, and Ramen-tei Asakusa. The nearest airport is Tokyo Haneda Airport.

Akihabara is known as the 'world's geek capital' with a vast category of video and computer games. Top attractions include Tokyo Anime Center, Ryōgoku Edo Noren, and Ginza Line Crossing. Visitors can shop at 2k540 Aki-Oka Artisan, witness lush greenery at Chidorigafuchi moat, and rent a bike to tour the place. Accommodations include APA Hotel Akihabaraeki Denkigaiguchi, Akihabara Washington Hotel, and Keikyu EX Inn Akihabara. Notable places to eat are Kyushu Jangara Ramen, Akihabara Tempura Hisago, and Tonkatsu Marugo. The nearest airport is Tokyo Haneda Airport.

Odaiba is a magnificent island known for its exquisite shopping centers and a Ferris wheel inside. Top attractions include Daikanransha Ferris wheel, Seaside Park, and Yurikamome train. Visitors can enjoy sushi at the sushi bars, shop at Aqua City, and spot fun robots at Miraikan science museum. Accommodations include Hilton Tokyo Odaiba, Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba, and Hotel Trusty Tokyo Bayside. Notable places to eat are KUA`AINA Odaiba, Gonpachi Odaiba, and Zest Cantina. The nearest airport is Tokyo Haneda Airport.

Kabukicho is known for its neon signs and is a main red-light area in Japan. Top attractions include the Robot Restaurant, Shinjuku Golden Gai, and Museum of Haiku Literature. Visitors can enjoy fun rides at VR Zone Shinjuku, watch a Tokyo Robot Evening Cabaret Show, and learn about Haiku at the Museum of Haiku Literature. Accommodations include APA Hotel Higashi Shinjuku Kabukicho and Shinjuku Granbell Hotel. Notable places to eat are Oedo Ayatori, Robot Restaurant, and Kuriya. The nearest airport is Tokyo International Airport.

Ueno Park in Tokyo offers a diverse array of attractions, making it a prominent tourist destination. It includes the Tokyo National Museum, Ueno Zoo, and Kaneiji Temple. Activities include Hanami, visiting the National Museum of Nature and Science, and experiencing the serenity at Ueno Toshogu Shrine. Accommodations nearby include Ueno Hotel, Candeo Hotels Ueno Koen, and APA Hotel Keisei Ueno-Ekimae. Notable dining options are Inshotei, Khana Pina, Ueno Izuei, and Umekawa-tei. The closest airport is Tokyo Haneda Airport.

Yokohama, located close to Tokyo, offers a charming Minato Mirai waterfront and one of the biggest Chinatown regions. Top attractions include Yokohama Chinatown, Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse, and Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise. Activities include visiting Enoshima Island, exploring Sankeien Garden, and enjoying the Shin-Yokohama Ramen Museum. Accommodations include The Yokohama Bay Hotel Tokyu, InterContinental Yokohama Grand, and Yokohama Royal Park Hotel. Dining options are Charcoal Grill Green, Azamino, Ukai-tei, and Ippudo. The nearest international airport is Pohang Airport.

Nikko, located in Tochigi Prefecture, is rich in history and features attractions like Kanmangafuchi Abyss, Toshogu Shrine, Kegon Falls, and Nikko Futarasan jinja. Activities include dipping toes in the hot springs of Kinugawa Onsen, exploring the Rinnō-ji museum, and hiking through Senjōgahara. Accommodations include Oku Nikko Hotel Shikisai, Nikko Kanaya Hotel, and Nikko Park Lodge Mountain Side. Notable dining options are Hippari-Dako, Gyoza no Umechan, and Meiji-no-Yakata. The nearest airports are Ibaraki and Fukushima Airports.

Tohoku, also known as the hidden gem of Japan’s main island region, offers attractions like Lake Ogawara, Hotto Plaza Suginoko Hot Spring, and Eboshi-dake. Activities include camping at Ogawarako Park, enjoying a nature walk at Komaki Onsen Shibusawa Park, and dining at Onsen inn Matsuzono. Accommodations include Hotel New Tohoku, Almont Hotel Sendai, and Westin Hotel Sendai. Dining options are Restaurant Karinba, Marche Restaurant, and Steak House Yoshino. The best way to explore Tohoku is by buying a Japan Rail pass.

Kawagoe, known as 'Little Edo,' is a town with remnants from the Edo Period (1603-1867). Top attractions include Kitain Temple, Warehouse District, Honmaru Goten, and Candy Alley. Activities include visiting the city museum, exploring Kitain Temple, and viewing the remnants of Kawagoe’s palace. Accommodations include Kawagoe Prince Hotel, Kawagoe Daiichi Hotel, and Kawagoe Tobu Hotel. Dining options are Kawagoe Ichinoya, Atre Ogakiku, and cafe torocco. The nearest airports are Narita International Airport and Haneda Airport in Tokyo.

Nagoya, one of the biggest cities in Central Japan, is home to attractions like Nagoya Castle, Atsuta Jingu, Higashiyama Zoo and Botanical Gardens, Tokugawa Garden, and Nagoya City Science Museum. Activities include strolling through the castle, witnessing the serenity of Tokugawa Garden, exploring the science museum, and enjoying cherry blossoms at Tsuruma Park. Accommodations include Kyoya Ryokan Nagoya, Hotel MyStays Nagoya Sakae, and Nagoya JR Gate Tower Hotel. Dining options are Atsuta Horaiken – Main Restaurant, Midtown BBQ – Nagoya, and Yamamotoya. The nearest airport is Chūbu Centrair International Airport.

Kanazawa, the capital of Ishikawa Prefecture, features historical attractions like reconstructed residences and contemporary museums. Top attractions include Kenroku-en Garden, 21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art, Omicho Market, and Kanazawa Castle. Activities include devouring authentic seafood, touring the castle, and witnessing the beauty of the garden. Accommodations include Emblem Stay Kanazawa, Hotel Mystays Premier Kanazawa, and Hotel Trusty Kanazawa Korinbo. Dining options are Fuwari, Sushi Ippei, and Pizzeria e Trattoria Da TAKE. The nearest airport is in Komatsu.

Shirakawago is a village in the valley of Ono District, known for its 'gassho-zukuri' buildings built to withstand heavy snow. Top attractions include Fairytale Houses, Wada House, Gassho-zukuri Minkaen, and Hakusan National Park. Activities include learning about traditional Japanese life, witnessing the landscapes, and camping at Hakusan National Park. Accommodations include Onyado Yuinosho, Shirakawa-go Terrace, and Hostel Fujiya. Dining options are Yukinko and Irori Shiraogi. The nearest airport is Fukushima Airport, 21 km away.

Shikoku, one of Japan’s four main islands, blends nature, tranquility, culture, and cuisine. Top attractions include Muroto-Misaki, Ishizuchi-San, Iya Valley, and Dogo Onsen. Activities include relaxing at the oldest spa in Japan, strolling the pilgrimage route connecting 88 temples, and cycling around the island. Accommodations include Sunriver Oboke and Kotohira Kadan. Dining options are Ofukuro, Good Food Studio, Cardamon, and Hamakaidoh. The best way to reach Shikoku is by bus from Osaka Kansai via Takamatsu Chuo Interchange Bus Terminal, taking about 6 hours.

Nagasaki, known for its peace memorial, offers attractions like Nagasaki Dutch Slope, Nagasaki Chinatown, Kofukuji Temple, and Glover Garden. Activities include learning history at Nagasaki Atomic Bomb Museum, seeing penguins at Nagasaki Penguin Aquarium, and traveling around the city on the Nagasaki Electric Tramway. Accommodations include Hotel Monterey Nagasaki, Luke Plaza Hotel, and Casa Blanca Guesthouse. Dining options are Kagetsu, Horaiken Bekkan Shippoku, and Hamakatsu. The nearest airports are Kumamoto and Fukuoka Airports.

Kobe is located between Mount Rokko and the sea. Known for its delicious beef, Kobe offers attractions such as Wakamatsu Park, Arima Onsen, and Kobe Oji Zoo. Activities include walking on Akashi Kaikyo Bridge, trying local delicacies, and trekking Mount Rokko. Accommodations include Kobe Meriken Park Oriental Hotel, Kobe Sannomiya Union Hotel, and Hotel Plaza Kobe. Dining options are Kobe Beef Steak Restaurant Royal Mouriya, La Shomon, and Kokoroya. Kansai International Airport is the nearest international airport, 70 km away.

Fukuoka, the oldest city in Japan, is located on the southernmost island of Kyushu. It is an important port city known for its rich culture, relaxed vibe, and food culture. Top attractions include Fukuoka Castle, Canal City Hakata, and Ohori Park. Activities include evening walks at Yusentei Park, visiting Hakozaki Shrine, and enjoying karaoke nights. Accommodations include Plaza Hotel Premier and Fukuoka Plaza Hotel Tenjin. Dining options are Yoshizuka Unagi, Beef Taigen, and Hyotan Sushi. The closest airport is Saga Airport.

Hitsujiyama Park is famous for its cherry blossoms, offering a picturesque setting with over 400,000 trees of nine different varieties. Top attractions include Shibazakura Hill, Mount Buko, and Nagatoro. Activities include catching the Chichibu Shibazakura Festival, hiking trails, and buying festival snacks and souvenirs. Accommodations include Hotel Route Inn Chichibu, Araki Kosen Ryokan, and Guest House Nishiki. Dining options are Laboratorino, Nosaka, Horumon, and Takasago. The park is accessible via the Seibu Limited Express Chichibu train from Ikebukuro, taking around 1 hour and 20 minutes.

Hakone offers great views of Mount Fuji and is a popular destination for both day trips and overnight stays. Top attractions include Lake Ashinoko, Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park, and the Open Air Museum. Activities include enjoying multiple hot springs, taking the ropeway to the boiling sulfur pits, and crisscrossing Lake Ashi on a pirate ship. Accommodations include Kinnotake Tonosawa, Hakone Senkei, Okudo-Saryo, and Rikyu-an inn. Dining options are Hakone Karaage Karatto, Gora Brewery & Grill, and Monsmare. Hakone can be reached via Odakyu Railway, Japan Railways, or the Odakyu Hakone Highway Bus.
19C Hoàng Diệu, Điện Bàn, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam

Imperial Citadel of Thang Long is a World Heritage Site since 2010 and was the former political centre of Vietnam for 13 uninterrupted centuries. It is a vintage fortress reflecting Vietnamese military power with relics of age-old roads, palaces, wells, ponds, potteries, coins, and other war remnants found through archaeological expeditions. It is open from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. The entry fee is VND30,000.
2 Hùng Vương, Điện Bàn, Ba Đình, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam

Ho Chi Minh’s Mausoleum is a monumental marble construction built with materials collected from all over the country. It houses Ho Chi Minh’s well-preserved body in a glass sarcophagus. The mausoleum is closed from September 4th to November 4th for annual maintenance and preservation procedures in Russia. Visitors must follow certain restrictions such as not wearing short clothes, hats, or tank tops, and not talking on the phone or taking pictures inside. The entry is free of cost and it is open from 8:00 AM to 11:00 AM, Saturday to Thursday.
Hoan Kiem Lake And Ngoc Son
Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Hàng Trống, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam

Hoan Kiem Lake, also known as Turtle Lake, is famous for its natural beauty and is one of the most famous places to visit in Vietnam. The Ngoc Son Temple, located in the middle of the lake, is connected to the mainland by a small bridge and provides a picturesque backdrop. The lake is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. There is no entry fee for Hoan Kiem Lake, but there is an entry fee of VND30,000 for Ngoc Son Temple.
Nguyễn Văn Huyên, Quan Hoa, Cầu Giấy, Hà Nội 100000, Vietnam

Vietnam Museum of Ethnology focuses on the various ethnic groups of Vietnam. Constructed in 1997, it showcases changes over time and features the architectural work of Ha Duc Linh, a member of an ethnic group in Vietnam. The museum is open from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM. The entry fee is VND40,000 for adults, VND15,000 for Vietnamese students, and VND10,000 for students aged 6-8 years.
28A Điện Biên Phủ, Điện Bàn, Ba Đình, Hà Nội, Vietnam

Vietnam Military History Museum is one of the seven national museums in the country. It features military weapons and items from the Vietnam War. The museum was constructed on July 17th, 1956. It is open from 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. The entry fee is VND30,000.

The Temple of Literature is a Temple of Confucius and hosts the first national university of Vietnam, the Imperial Academy. The construction began in 1070 during the reign of Emperor Lý Thánh Tông. The site is famous for its picturesque architecture and historical significance. It is open all day. The entry fee is VND30,000 for adults and VND15,000 for students.
28 Võ Văn Tần, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

The War Remnants Museum displays various items and relics from different wars in world history, including weapons, armoured vehicles, bombs, bunkers, tanks, infantry weapons, and artillery items. It also has a section dedicated to photographs and posters of different anti-war movements globally. The museum is open from 7:00 AM to 12:30 PM and from 1:30 PM to 5:00 PM. The entry fee is VND15,000.
TL15, Phú Hiệp, Củ Chi, Hồ Chí Minh 733814, Vietnam

Cu Chi Tunnels is a sub-surface tunnel network created for communication purposes. The 250 km long network was dug in 1940 as a hiding place during the Vietnam War against France and was later used during the American war. It comprises meandering tunnels, dark and narrow branches, hidden doors, weapon storerooms, and secret routes for canals and rivers reaching up to the border of Cambodia. Some tunnels have been widened for visitors. It is open from 7:30 AM to 4:30 PM. Entry fee is not mentioned.

Mekong Delta is significant for its geographical features and abundance of rice cultivation on both banks. The most mesmerizing feature is the houseboats and markets that float on the rivers and canals intersecting the land. It is open throughout the day. There is no entry fee mentioned.
55B Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theatre is famous for its water puppetry, a tradition that originated almost 1000 years ago in the Red River Delta Region of Vietnam. Each show lasts 50 minutes and depicts the country’s culture and social life. The shows include live music performances featuring traditional Vietnamese instruments. The entry fee is VND100,000. Timings are not mentioned.
710 Nguyễn Trãi, Phường 11, Quận 5, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

Thien Hau Temple is one of the oldest Chinese temples in Ho Chi Minh City, dedicated to the Lady of the Sea, Thien Hau. Visitors seek solitude and experience the calm vibes with the aroma of incense sticks and flickering candles. The temple features porcelain dioramas depicting the Chinese way of living from the 19th century. It is open from 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. There is no entry fee mentioned.
7 Lam Son Square, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City

Saigon Opera House is an architectural marvel in French colonial style built as Opera de Saigon in 1897 by French architect Eugene Ferret. It became a theatre in 1975 where you can watch shows or attend the orchestra. Both the Ho Chi Minh City Ballet Symphony Orchestra and Opera perform here, with tickets available at the box office. Nearby attractions include the Notre Dame Cathedral and Reunification Palace. The building is famous for its French colonial style architecture. Timings are 9:00 AM to 4:30 PM (Monday to Friday) and 9:00 AM to 11:30 PM (Saturday and Sunday). There is no entry fee, but tickets are required for events.

Hoi An Ancient Town is an ancient coastal town and former trading post of south-eastern Asia. The town features a perfect amalgamation of eastern and western architecture, including Chinese Temples, a Japanese Designed Bridge, Pagoda, Old Canal, and French Colonial Houses. Hoi An is known for its serene and less crowded beaches and quaint cafes by the river. The entry fee is VND120,000.
176 Tran Phu, Minh An Ward, Hoi An, Quang Nam, Vietnam

The Cantonese Assembly Hall, located close to Bridge Pagoda, was established in the 18th century. The main altar is dedicated to Quan Cong, a Chinese general praised for his bravery and worshipped. The assembly hall is one of the five in Hoi An for different Chinese ethnic groups. It is known for its architecture. The hall is open from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. There is no entry fee.
Duy Phú, Duy Xuyên District, Quang Nam Province, Vietnam

My Son Sanctuary is an ancient site of art and architecture with immense historical significance. Located on the coast of central Vietnam, it was the capital of the Champa Kingdom. The site features partially demolished tower temples dedicated to Lord Shiva, built over 10 centuries (4th to 14th Century AD). The carvings reflect the culture, ethos, history, and heritage of south-east Asia. The site is open from 6:30 AM to 4:30 PM. The entry fee is VND150,000.
Quang Nam Province, Hoi An, Vietnam

Cham Island, locally known as Cu Lao Cham, is a small pristine island with an amazing landscape. The island is rich in marine biodiversity and comprises many endangered species. It is a 30-minute speedboat ride from Hoi An and is known for coral spotting, swimming, diving, and snorkelling. Staying overnight on the island offers a photogenic sunrise. The island is open throughout the day. The entry fee is VND70,000.
Lê Hồng Phong, Cẩm Hà, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam

Phuoc Lam Pagoda is unique in its design and architecture, providing tranquility and calmness. The pagoda is decorated with potted plants on the porch and religious statues on the walls. It is a famous historic site in Hoi An. The pagoda is open from 7:30 AM to 9:30 PM. There is no entry fee.

Old House of Phun Hung depicts the old charm of Hoi An and Vietnam as a whole. It is full of elements representing trade and local values of Vietnam. The house displays the old values of the country and is recorded as one of the World Heritage Sites. The house is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. There is no entry fee.
24 Trần Phú, Cẩm Châu, Hội An, Quảng Nam, Vietnam

Quan Cong Temple was constructed in 1653 and has been renovated multiple times while keeping the Chinese architecture intact. The temple is named after a Chinese rebel from the Han Dynasty. The Chinese military general is famous for his dedication and integrity towards his nation. The temple is open from 10:30 AM to 10:00 PM. The entry fee is VND120,000 per person.
Thành phố Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam

The Complex of Hue Monuments is a former political, cultural, and spiritual center of the Nguyen dynasty. Located near Hue city, the complex comprises age-old monuments set amid the Blue Mountains and the meandering Perfume River. The site includes former administrative, defense, and cultural headquarters, with several temples situated outside the boundary. The layout and planning demonstrate feudal urban planning. The complex is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. The entry fee is VND150,000 for adults and VND30,000 for children.

The Perfume River is known for its unique aroma, which comes from the rich flora and fauna underwater. It is a tranquil place to stroll along the riverside and enjoy the sunset. Sitting by the river and watching the boats is a romantic experience. The river is open throughout the day and does not have an entry fee.
Hương Hòa, Thành phố Huế, Hương Hòa Thành phố Huế Thừa Thiên Huế 532761, Vietnam

Pagoda Of The Celestial Lady is a popular seven-storeyed temple known for its historicity and as a significant Vietnam sightseeing spot. The temple, which has been a part of folklore, is erected atop the Hà Khê hill in the Hương Long ward. It is unofficially known as the symbol of the city of Hue. The pagoda is famous for its iconic seven-story structure. It is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM and there is no entry fee.
Khải Định, Thủy Bằng, Hương Thủy, Thừa Thiên Huế 530000, Vietnam

The Tomb Of Khai Dinh, also known as Ung Mausoleum, is established upon the Chau Chu mountain. Built for the 12th Emperor of the Nguyen Dynasty, the construction took 11 years (1920-31). The architecture reflects both Oriental and Occidental influences. It is famous for its architecture and history. The tomb is open from 7:00 AM to 5:30 PM and the entry fee is VND100,000.
1 Đoàn Hữu Trưng, Phước Vĩnh, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế 530000, Vietnam

Phu Cam Cathedral is a cathedral established atop a hill known for its rich orange plantation. The construction started in 1963 and underwent various renovations until 2000. The modern architecture reflects the expertise of architect Ngo Viet Thu. It is one of the biggest churches in the city. The cathedral is open from 5:00 AM to 6:30 PM and there is no entry fee.
58 Nguyễn Phúc Nguyên, Hương Long, Thành phố Huế, Huế, Vietnam

An Hien Garden House is an ideal place for nature lovers and those interested in the historical aspects of Hue and Vietnam. The garden house offers lush greenery and ancient architecture that provide insights into the history of the city and country. The house is open from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM and the entry fee is VND35,000.
On the western side of Gulf of Tokin

Halong Bay is known for its emerald blue water, marine cliffs, and magnificent karst topography. The bay features wind and wave-eroded limestone caves, sinkhole lakes, and grottoes. It was designated as a World Heritage Site in 1994 and is home to numerous islands. The entry fee is VND290,000.

Lan Ha Bay is known for its stunning scenery and peaceful environment. It is free from crowds and chaos, making it a perfect spot for honeymooners seeking solitude. Visitors can explore the bay by hiring a sailboat or kayak to reach more secluded areas. The bay is open throughout the day and there is no entry fee.
Ha Long Bay, Halong City, Quảng Ninh

Sung Sot Cave, also known as the Cave of Marvels, is one of the largest caves in Halong Bay. It features unique rock formations, including shapes like a Buddha, a tortoise, and a phallus, illuminated by lights. The cave offers a grand and mesmerizing experience. It is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM and there is no entry fee.

Cat Ba Island is the largest island in Halong Bay and the hub for water sport activities like swimming, snorkeling, kayaking, diving, and caving. It is also known for trekking, hiking, and rock climbing. The island provides plenty of space to relax, unwind, and sunbathe. The island is open from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM and there is no entry fee.

Dau Be Island is famous for its diverse flora and fauna, including flying squirrels, golden monkeys, and various bird species. The island has three ocean basins and a cave with unique rock formations. It is ideal for snorkeling and swimming, with rich marine life and vibrant corals. The island is open all day and there is no entry fee.
About 14 kilometres to the east of Bai Chay tourist harbour, Vietnam

Ti Top Island is named after Russian astronaut Gherman Titov. It is known for its scenic beauty and recreational activities like swimming, kayaking, snorkeling, and hiking. The island's summit can be reached by a steep climb, offering panoramic views from the mountaintop gazebo. The island is open all day and the entry fee is VND50.

Ta Phin Village is located 17km west of Sa Pa and is home to the Red Dao people, who maintain their traditional lifestyle away from modernity. The roads to the village are not suitable for cars, so visitors can hire bikes. The journey offers stunning views. The entry fee is VND40,000.

Fansipan Mountain is the highest mountain in the Indochinese Peninsula, famously known as the roof of Indochina. It offers stunning sceneries and a beautiful landscape, ideal for trekking expeditions for adventure enthusiasts. Alternatively, visitors can take a cable car ride to witness the panoramic views of the Indochina region. The mountain is rich in flora and fauna, and visitors can marvel at the views of swirling clouds and forested slopes. The entry fee for the Fansipan cable car tickets is VND70,000 per person (adults).
QL4D, San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

Silver Waterfall is a mesmerizing waterfall with white water cascading down a giant slope of a hill. The sunlight falling on the waters gives it a shining color, making it look like silver, hence the name Silver Waterfall. It is visible from afar and is ideal for hiking adventures. The waterfall is open 24 hours, and the entry fee is VND20,000.

Hoang Lien National Park is one of the most important national parks in Vietnam, situated at a height of 3,000 meters above sea level. The park boasts ecotourism and is a hub for scientific research with an extensive range of forests and exotic wildlife. Visitors can explore the wilderness through trekking expeditions and enjoy the natural beauty. The park is open 24 hours, and the entry fee is VND5.

Da Nang is the fourth largest city in Vietnam, located halfway between Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City. It is known for its quirky bridge, museum, stunning beaches, fascinating restaurants, and dazzling nightlife. The city is famous for its stunning beaches and lively atmosphere. The entry fee for attractions in Da Nang is VND40,000.

Nha Trang is the capital city of Khanh Hoa Province and a popular coastal destination with a crescent-shaped beach and a turquoise bay dotted with small islands and surrounded by hills. It is one of the most popular beach destinations in Vietnam, known for its Po Nagar Tower built by Champa Rulers, scuba diving centers, stunning beaches, pristine landscapes, and cool, comfortable climate. The entry fee for activities in Nha Trang is VND600,000 per person (adults).
Near Cua Lo beach, Nghe An, Vietnam

Lan Chau Island, also known as Ru Coc (toad) island, is located near Cua Lo beach and is famous for its white sand beaches and crystal clear waters. The island's steep cliffs and unique rock formations make it a popular spot for relaxation and scenic views. The island is open throughout the day and there is no entry fee.

Buon Ma Thuot, known as the coffee capital of Vietnam, offers pristine nature and a rustic experience. The town hosts the Biennial Coffee Festival and is known for its coffee production. Visitors can explore the Yok Don National Park, Vietnam's largest nature reserve, and visit striking waterfalls and local villages to experience the local culture. There is no entry fee for attractions in Buon Ma Thuot.
Bá Thước District, Thanh Hoa, Vietnam

Pu Luong Nature Reserve is an offbeat destination known for its large number of rice paddies and stunning limestone panoramas. Located roughly 170 km from Hanoi, visitors can enjoy trekking, cycling, and exploring small villages. The reserve is a hidden gem with scenic beauty and is open all day with no entry fee.

Dalat is located on the Lang Biang highlands around a lake and a golf course. It is known for its cool and serene climate, with pleasant days and cool nights. The city boasts stunning lakes, waterfalls, lush green valleys, and vibrant flower beds, making it a perfect holiday retreat. There is no entry fee for attractions in Dalat.
South China Sea, Southeast Vietnam, Vietnam

The Sand Dunes of Mui Ne are spectacular white and red sand dunes eroded by oceanic wind. The winds have carved out amazing formations such as Barchans and Sieve, showcasing stunning desert topography. The dunes are a popular tourist spot, especially during peak season, and visitors can explore the area by hiring sledges, quad bikes, buggies, or taking an ostrich ride. The entry fee is VND10,000.

Phu Quoc is located about 50 km from the Vietnam mainland and is a spectacular island on the Gulf of Thailand. It is famous for its sparkling white sand beaches, nearly transparent crystal-clear water, virgin shoreline, bustling shacks, and serene environment. Visitors can enjoy the photogenic sunset or take a stroll along the beaches. The island is open all day and there is no entry fee.

Ninh Binh is located at the southern end of the Red River Delta and represents a typical Vietnamese rural scene with lush green paddy fields, verdant mountains, and winding rivers cutting through the village. It was the former capital of Vietnam and is known for its breathtaking beauty. The area is open all day and there is no entry fee.
